snippet: Facing difficulties with distribution, The Orange County Register has asked its workers to help out, especially on Sunday and Thanksgiving morning.
abstract: Orange County Register, facing difficulties with distribution, has asked its workers, including reporters, to help deliver newspapers and return phone calls from readers who did not get their paper; Register and other newspapers are devising new ways to trim year-end costs in industry that has lost 40 percent of its revenue since a peak of $60 billion in 2005; analysts warn some cost-cutting efforts can backfire.
lead_paragraph: Facing difficulties with distribution, The Orange County Register has asked its workers to help out, especially on Sunday and Thanksgiving morning.

headline.main: California Paper Asks Its Employees to Produce, Then Deliver, the News
headline.print_headline: California Paper Asks Its Employees to Produce, Then Deliver, the News
